edu.ucla.sspace.vector
Class AmortizedSparseVector

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.vector.AmortizedSparseVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleVector, SparseDoubleVector, SparseVector<Double>, Vector<Double>, Serializable
public class AmortizedSparseVector
extends Object
implements SparseDoubleVector, Serializable

An implementation of a sparse vector based on the Yale Sparse matrix format. This class offers better access for modification efficiency over SparseVector at the expense of increased memory usage, for certain usage patterns. Only non-zero values in the vector are stored in an ArrayList, which tracks both the index of the value, and the value itself. Lookups for all indices are O(log n). Writes to already existing indices are O(log n). Writes to non-existing indices are dependent on the insertion time of a ArrayList, but are at a minimum O(log n).

Author:
Keith Stevens
See Also:

toArray

public double[] toArray()
Returns a double array representing this vector. The returned array will be "safe" in that no changes to the array will be reflected in the vector, and likewise for changes to to the vector. The caller is thus free to modify the returned array.

Specified by:
toArray in interface DoubleVector
Returns:
a double array of this vector.
